birth_place.en: Kuaiji County, Shaoxing Prefecture, Zhejiang Province

description.zh-cn: 中国近代散文家、文学理论家、评论家、诗人、翻译家，新文化运动代表人物。鲁迅之弟，周建人之兄。曾任国立北京大学教授、汪精卫政权华北政务委员会委员兼教育总署督办等职。战后因汉奸罪被判刑，中华人民共和国成立后专事翻译和写作。
description.en: A modern Chinese essayist, literary theorist, critic, poet, and translator, and a representative figure of the New Culture Movement. He was the younger brother of Lu Xun and the elder brother of Zhou Jianren. He served as a professor at Peking University and as a member and Director-General of the Education Bureau of the North China Political Council under the Wang Jingwei regime. After the war, he was imprisoned for treason. After the founding of the People's Republic of China, he dedicated himself to translation and writing.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代文学家、思想家、革命家，五四新文化运动的重要参与者，中国现代文学的奠基人之一。周作人之兄。
description.en: A leading figure of modern Chinese literature. A writer, thinker, and revolutionary, he was a key participant in the May Fourth New Culture Movement and one of the founders of modern Chinese literature. Elder brother of Zhou Zuoren.

description.zh-cn: 中国生物学家、政治活动家，鲁迅和周作人的弟弟。
description.en: A Chinese biologist and political activist, younger brother of Lu Xun and Zhou Zuoren.

description.zh-cn: 周作人的日本籍妻子。
description.en: The Japanese wife of Zhou Zuoren.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代学者、思想家、革命家。周作人与鲁迅留学日本时的老师。
description.en: A modern Chinese scholar, philosopher, and revolutionary. He was the teacher of Zhou Zuoren and Lu Xun when they studied in Japan.

description.zh-cn: 五四运动后成立的文学社团，由周作人、郑振铎、沈雁冰等人发起。
description.en: A literary society founded after the May Fourth Movement, initiated by Zhou Zuoren, Zheng Zhenduo, Shen Yanbing, and others.

description.zh-cn: 中国著名高等学府，周作人曾在此长期任教并担任多个职务。
description.en: A renowned institution of higher learning in China where Zhou Zuoren taught for a long time and held several positions.

description.zh-cn: 汪精卫政权下的地方政权机构，周作人曾在此任职。
description.en: A local government body under the Wang Jingwei regime, where Zhou Zuoren held a position.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产主义的先驱，中国共产党主要创始人之一，1927年被张作霖杀害。
description.en: A pioneer of Chinese communism and one of the main founders of the Chinese Communist Party, executed by Zhang Zuolin in 1927.

description.zh-cn: 奉系军阀首领，统治中国东北，1927年下令处决李大钊等人。
description.en: Warlord of the Fengtian clique who controlled Northeast China and ordered the execution of Li Dazhao and others in 1927.

description.zh-cn: 李大钊之子，曾受周作人庇护。
description.en: Son of Li Dazhao, who was once sheltered by Zhou Zuoren.

description.zh-cn: 李大钊之女，曾受周作人庇护。
description.en: Daughter of Li Dazhao, who was once sheltered by Zhou Zuoren.

description.zh-cn: 中国教育家，曾任北京大学校长。抗战爆发后，曾委托周作人留守北平看管校产。
description.en: A Chinese educator and former president of Peking University. After the outbreak of the Anti-Japanese War, he entrusted Zhou Zuoren to stay in Beiping to look after the university's property.

description.zh-cn: 1925年至1948年间中华民国的中央政府。抗战胜利后，其主导的政府以汉奸罪名逮捕并审判了周作人。
description.en: The central government of the Republic of China from 1925 to 1948. After the victory in the Anti-Japanese War, the government it led arrested and tried Zhou Zuoren for treason.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国时期的一场政治运动，周作人在运动初期遭到批斗和迫害，并于1967年去世。
description.en: A political movement in the People's Republic of China. Zhou Zuoren was persecuted at the beginning of the movement and died in 1967.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党、中华人民共和国的主要缔造者和领导人。1920年曾拜访过周作人，1949年后批示允许周作人从事翻译工作。
description.en: The main founder and leader of the Communist Party of China and the People's Republic of China. He visited Zhou Zuoren in 1920 and, after 1949, approved for Zhou to work as a translator.

description.zh-cn: 清末在南京创办的新式军事学堂，周作人于1901年入学，学习轮机专业。
description.en: A modern military academy founded in Nanjing in the late Qing Dynasty. Zhou Zuoren enrolled in 1901 to study marine engineering.

description.zh-cn: 由鲁迅和周作人合译的外国短篇小说集，是中国近代翻译文学的早期重要成果。
description.en: A collection of foreign short stories co-translated by Lu Xun and Zhou Zuoren, an early and important achievement in modern Chinese translated literature.

description.zh-cn: 周作人是鲁迅（周树人）的弟弟。
description.en: Zhou Zuoren was the younger brother of Lu Xun (Zhou Shuren).

description.zh-cn: 周作人是周建人的哥哥。
description.en: Zhou Zuoren was the elder brother of Zhou Jianren.

description.zh-cn: 周作人在日本留学期间与羽太信子结婚。
description.en: Zhou Zuoren married Hatano Nobuko while studying in Japan.

description.zh-cn: 周作人在日本留学时，曾师从章太炎学习《说文解字》。
description.en: While studying in Japan, Zhou Zuoren was a student of Zhang Taiyan, learning the 'Shuowen Jiezi'.

description.zh-cn: 1901年进入江南水师学堂管轮班学习，共6年。
description.en: Enrolled in the marine engineering class at Jiangnan Naval Academy in 1901 for 6 years.

description.zh-cn: 五四运动之后，与郑振铎、沈雁冰、叶绍钧、许地山等人共同发起成立“文学研究会”。
description.en: After the May Fourth Movement, co-founded the 'Literary Research Association' with Zheng Zhenduo, Shen Yanbing, Ye Shaojun, Xu Dishan, and others.

position.zh-cn: 国史编纂处编纂、文科教授、东方文学系主任、图书馆馆长、文学院院长
position.en: Compiler at the National History Compilation Office, Professor of the Faculty of Arts, Head of the Department of Oriental Literature, Director of the Library, Dean of the Faculty of Arts

description.zh-cn: 周作人自1917年起在北京大学任职，抗战期间留守北平后，于1939年起担任汪精卫政权下的北京大学图书馆馆长及文学院院长等职务。
description.en: Zhou Zuoren worked at Peking University starting in 1917. After staying in Beiping during the Anti-Japanese War, he served as the Director of the Peking University Library and Dean of the Faculty of Arts under the Wang Jingwei regime from 1939.

position.zh-cn: 常务委员兼教育总署督办
position.en: Standing Committee Member and Director-General of the Education Bureau

description.zh-cn: 1940年12月，汪精卫政权任命周作人为华北政务委员会委员，并指定为常务委员兼教育总署督办。
description.en: In December 1940, the Wang Jingwei regime appointed Zhou Zuoren as a member of the North China Political Council, designated as a Standing Committee Member and Director-General of the Education Bureau.

description.zh-cn: 1927年，奉系军阀张作霖下令绞死了李大钊等20余名国民党及共产党员。
description.en: In 1927, warlord Zhang Zuolin ordered the execution by hanging of Li Dazhao and over 20 other Kuomintang and Communist party members.

description.zh-cn: 在李大钊被杀害后，周作人将李大钊的儿子李葆华藏在家中加以保护。
description.en: After Li Dazhao was killed, Zhou Zuoren hid his son Li Baohua in his home for protection.

description.zh-cn: 在李大钊被杀害后，周作人将李大钊的女儿李星华藏在家中加以保护。
description.en: After Li Dazhao was killed, Zhou Zuoren hid his daughter Li Xinghua in his home for protection.

description.zh-cn: 抗日战争爆发后，时任北京大学校长的蒋梦麟委托教授周作人留在北平看守校产。
description.en: After the outbreak of the Anti-Japanese War, Jiang Menglin, then president of Peking University, entrusted Professor Zhou Zuoren to stay in Beiping to look after the university's property.

description.zh-cn: 抗日战争结束后，国民政府于1945年12月以汉奸罪名逮捕周作人，并将其判刑监禁，直至1949年1月释放。
description.en: After the end of the Anti-Japanese War, the Nationalist Government arrested Zhou Zuoren in December 1945 on charges of treason and imprisoned him until his release in January 1949.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命开始后，周作人遭到红卫兵的批斗和殴打，家产被查封，最终在迫害中于1967年5月去世。
description.en: After the Cultural Revolution began, Zhou Zuoren was denounced and beaten by Red Guards, his property was confiscated, and he eventually died amid the persecution in May 1967.

description.zh-cn: 根据周作人日记记载，毛泽东于1920年4月7日拜访了他。
description.en: According to Zhou Zuoren's diary, Mao Zedong visited him on April 7, 1920.

description.zh-cn: 在收到周作人的信后，毛泽东批示“养起来，做翻译工作”，使得周作人能在中华人民共和国成立后以翻译为生。
description.en: After receiving a letter from Zhou Zuoren, Mao Zedong instructed to 'support him and let him do translation work,' which allowed Zhou Zuoren to make a living as a translator after the founding of the PRC.

description.zh-cn: 与哥哥鲁迅合作翻译并出版了《域外小说集》。
description.en: Collaborated with his brother Lu Xun to translate and publish 'Tales from Abroad'.

description.zh-cn: 与弟弟周作人合作翻译并出版了《域外小说集》，并校订了周作人翻译的各篇。
description.en: Collaborated with his brother Zhou Zuoren to translate and publish 'Tales from Abroad', and proofread the pieces translated by Zhou Zuoren.
